intro: Olax sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe olax, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, rounded growth habit and small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruit is a spherical capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Olax sphaerocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
